title: Endoilluminator phototoxic maculopathy associated with combined ICG-assisted epiretinal membrane and internal limiting membrane peeling
patient: A 67-year-old man with a history of diabetic macular edema developed a concomitant ERM (). Visual acuity was 20/60 with no metamorphopsia. He underwent a standard three-port 25-gauge pars plana vitrectomy with sequential ICG-assisted ERM and ILM peeling, in the same fashion as described above. This patient also received 2 mg of triamcinolone at the end of the case. At the 1-month postoperative visit, we noted a similar fan-shaped pigmentary alteration that was evident on infrared imaging (). In the areas of outer retinal disturbances, SD-OCT showed focal discontinuities of the external limiting membrane, outer nuclear layer, and ellipsoid zone, as well as underlying RPE mottling (), which had improved on the 4-month postoperative visit (). Fundus photography and autofluorescence (AF) were obtained on the final visit, which showed scattered foci of mixed hyper-and hypo-AF (). Final visual acuity improved to 20/30, with no scotoma.
